body:
Cythoning (0.28.3) the following
```
cimport foo

def bar():
    foo.baz
```
results in
```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cimport foo
       ^
------------------------------------------------------------

foo.pyx:1:8: 'foo.pxd' not found

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
cimport foo

def bar():
    foo.baz()
      ^
------------------------------------------------------------

foo.pyx:4:7: cimported module has no attribute 'baz'
```

I would suggest that the second error ("cimported module has not attribute 'baz'") could be suppressed (as well as any other error regarding symbols from that non-existent cimported module).  Typically, this indicates an error in the installation of "foo", which is the only relevant exception here.  If compiling a fully-fledged module with dozens of references to attributes of "foo", then the additional missing-attribute errors are noise that drown out the only relevant error (the failure to cimport).
title: Don't display "cimported module has no attribute 'baz'" for non-cimportable modules
